intro: Euphrasia mendoncae, commonly known as Mendo's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent yellow spots, which are characteristic of the genus Euphrasia. It is often found in open habitats such as dunes and coastal scrub. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
